DKB is Germany's second biggest direct bank.
A language learning app with a mission to make learning "universally available". In the 2020s, paywalled content and data breaches affected users.

An American multinational payment card services corporation, offering a range of payment transaction processing and other related-payment services.

Specialty retail company specializing in smart home devices, LED lighting, and personal audio equipment.

Mojang is a video game company most known for creating Minecraft.
OpenAI is an AI focused megacorporation that owns ChatGPT.
Pearson is an education company that has a variety of subsidiaries that do everything from publishing educational books to providing IT exams.
Photo sharing website founded in 2009 where users can "pin" various images to their profile and add them to collections.
Proton is a privacy-focused tech company.  Their main services include Proton Mail, Proton VPN and Proton Pass.
Finnish mobile game developer known for the ''Angry Birds'' series. In the 2020s, the original games were delisted and puts users through arbitration.
Messaging app founded in 2011 that popularized streaks, disappearing messages, and images called "snaps".
A company that runs High Speed 1 (HS1) which runs between London St Pancras Itl and Ashford Itl.
An app founded in 2023 that allows women to share information about and review local men regarding dating. The app requires identity verification for users.
Temu is a fast fashion company which is known for offering low-priced goods shipped directly from China.
MVNO founded by the Trump Organization. Soon after the launch, issues with signing up, false advertising, and double charges emerged.
